p.s: My name is Faraj al-Byarshan and I am immigrated to New York from Iraq in 2005.
I am now 41 years old and became an engineer.
My journey was in contrast to other immigrations safer and better but I was without my family.
My two sons and my wife came 2 years later to New York thatsthat's why I was the whole journey alone without anybody I knew.
I immigrated to New York because in my country was war and here in the US are better living conditions and especially for my children better education chances.
On my way I met another guy who was in the same situation as me and we understood each other really well.
We decided to become friends but we were lost each other in front of the border to the US because the gorvernment took us to different places to check our identity.
At this time I felt alone again but I knew it was getting better when I am in the US and can get a US citizenship.
First of all my friend and I travelled with a boat across a sea which was not that good but we have the chance to go on another boat from people who were educated so safesave migrants like us.
That is why I said at the begin that my journey was a safe one.
We did not think we were dying or fall into the water like other refugees do.
When I was the first day here in the US I get a timeline in which I had to go after certain years but this does not make me feel sad.
I knew when my family arrive this does not matter then because we have a right to stay here with our childschildren.

For my future or for our future I hope my sons get a good education to find a job where they earn enough money that we all can stay here for our lifeslives and that we all stay healthy and getting part of the americanAmerican society.
